title: Current-Mode Control of a Distributed Buck Converter with a Lossy Transmission Line
content: This article presents a buck converter in which the inductor has been replaced by a transmission line. This approach would be practically conceivable if the power supply and load have a greater spatial distance. In the time domain, this new converter can be described by a system of coupled partial and ordinary differential equations. In the frequency domain, a transcendental transfer function is obtained. For comparison with an equivalently parameterized conventional converter, Pad√© approximants are derived. A linear controller is designed for the converter topology under consideration.
